segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the path and the little bushes, all so neat and tidy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s such a nice day outside, but in here, it’s pure madness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes, while water pours everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don’t understand how she can be so calm with all this going on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and she doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could be out there in the garden instead of watching this disaster unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just spreading, and the floor is getting more and more slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope no one gets hurt before she finally turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the outside and inside is just too much.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice what’s happening right behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR
